author: yaraelpoof
title: It's got the street-ball feel... Not much else.
review: Wow. That's all I said when I finished building this set. It really has that feeling like you're in the city, playing in a park or alley. The set itself is poorly designed with the colored grey and red plank that sticks out so you can make slam-dunks. You have to pick up the whole post up to bring up the mini-fig. The only part that doesn't make this a one star set is the black gate and skateboard that build up the character of this set.

author: thepeopleperson
title: Not too great...
review:
This was the first basketball set I got, and I guess it was fun for a little while before I got the others. m Here are pros and cons.

Pros:
Comes with backboard and hoop
Skateboard
Comes with extra basketballs
Dunking catapult thing works well
catapult can move so you can dunk from different angles

Cons:
Why would there be an "NBA" minifig playing in thos alley thing?
Basket will fall off of backboard after so many dunks
Has to stand by itself-can't be added to other basketball sets

This is an OK set, but if you skip it, you won't miss out on much.

author: legofan13
title: average set, good pieces
review:
This set is an average set that is not to spectacular by itself but it's fun to play with and it gives you some nice pieces.

Pros

  • Pro 1 It works

    Pro 2 The minifigure can shoot hoops standing on the ground

  • Pro 3 The set contains a handful of mechanical pieces

Cons

  • Con 1 The backboard has designs on it so it might be hard to use the piece for something else.
  • Con 2 The minifigure looks strange.

Overall a good set but I wouldn't pay more than $15 for it.

author: KX
title: Ballin' (But not that much)
review:
I remember getting this set as a birthday gift.  What intrigued me the most is the minifigure. It was quite new to me because it had springs on its legs to "help" it shoot the ball.  The set itself was not that exciting.  The only thing that made me happy back then was: (1) I got a basketball inspired set. (2) It has a skateboard piece and (3) Well, since it was a gift, I didn't spend any money.

Parts

For children, parts were a bit bland.  But if you plan to make a streetball inspired MOC, the hoop and backboard helps.  Other pieces, not that much.

 

Building  Experience

It was fun. But once your done, it feels kinda bland looking at it.

 

Playability

Depending on how strong you press the "dunking feature", the ball is always sure to go in.  Making shots via flicking the minifig (to simulate the jumpshot) is a bit tricky.

 

Anyways, if you are a fan of old school Lego and NBA, this set is good.  But other than that, sad to say, you can just ignore this set.
